Semoga Wishnutama Mau Datang ke Festival Lembah Baliem
01 Nov 2019, 09:16 by Afif Farhan


Suku Dani yang melakukan tarian perang di Festival Lembah Baliem (Sastri/detikTravel)

FOKUS BERITA
Duet Wishnutama-Angela TanoeJakarta - Papua punya Festival Lembah Baliem yang terkenal sampai mendunia. Sayangnya, belum pernah ada menteri pariwisata yang datang ke sana.Festival Lembah Baliem berlokasi di Lembah Baliem, Wamena. Di festival inilah, suku Dani akan unjuk gigi dan memamerkan kebudayannya. Dari menampilkan tarian, sampai pesta bakar batu.Festival Lembah Baliem pun sudah berumur 30 tahun. Seperti dilansir CNN Indonesia, baru ada satu menteri yang datang ke sana yakni Menteri Yohana Yembise pada pertengahan bulan Agustus 2019 kemarin."Saya rasa Wishnutama sebagai Menteri Pariwisata dan Ekonomi Kreatif yang baru, harus datang ke sana," kata pengamat pariwisata sekaligus pendiri Binus University Cultural and Tourism Research, Vitria Ariani kepada detikcom, Jumat (1/11/2019).


Festival Lembah Baliem (Sastri/detikTravel)

BACA JUGA: Desa Wisata Menanti Sentuhan WishnutamaWanita yang akrab disapa Ria itu menambahkan, pihak penyelenggara Festival Lembah Baliem sudah sering kali mengundang menteri pariwisata untuk hadir. Sayangnya, menteri pariwisata belum pernah ada yang datang."Festival Lembah Baliem tidak pernah didatangi menteri pariwisata. Mereka di sana itu teriak-teriak lho sampai hopeless. Kasihan," ujarnya.


Pengamat Pariwisata Vitria Ariani (dok Istimewa)

Menurut Ria, kedatangan seorang menteri pariwisata ke sana akan menjadi berkah bagi masyarakat Lembah Baliem. Artinya, festival mereka, kebudayaan mereka makin dihargai dan berharap bisa dipromosikan lebih."Kita tahu Wishnutama adalah seorang yang jenius untuk membuat suatu event atau festival. Kehadirannya di sana bisa merangkul masyarakatnya dan mengembangkan serta mengenalkan potensi pariwisata Papua," papar Ria."Bahkan, Pak Presiden Jokowi sudah sering kunjungan ke Papua. Sudah saatnya, kita lebih memperhatikan pariwisata di timur Indonesia yang tak kalah indah," tutupnya.Simak Video "Siap Jadi Menteri, Wishnutama Bahas Kreativitas Bareng Jokowi"[Gambas:Video 20detik](aff/aff)

Hopefully Wishnutama Wants to Come to the Baliem Valley Festival
Nov 1, 2019, 09:16 by Afif Farhan


Dani people who do war dances at the Baliem Valley Festival (Sastri / detikTravel)

NEWS FOCUS
Wishnutama-Angela Tanoe duet Jakarta - Papua has the famous Baliem Valley Festival to the world. Unfortunately, no tourism minister has ever been there. The Baliem Valley Festival is located in the Baliem Valley, Wamena. At this festival, the Dani will show their teeth and show off their culture. From performing dances, to stone-burning parties. The Baliem Valley Festival is already 30 years old. As reported by CNN Indonesia, there was only one minister who came there, Minister Yohana Yembise in mid-August 2019 yesterday. "I think Wishnutama, as the new Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy, should come there," said tourism observer and founder of Binus University Cultural and Tourism Research, Vitria Ariani told AFP on Friday (1/11/2019).


Baliem Valley Festival (Sastri / detikTravel)

READ ALSO: The Tourism Village Awaits Wishnutama's Touch. The woman who is familiarly called Ria added, the organizer of the Baliem Valley Festival has often invited the minister of tourism to attend. "The Baliem Valley Festival has never been visited by the minister of tourism. They were there screaming until they were hopeless. Poor people," he said.


Tourism Observer Vitria Ariani (Special doc)

According to Ria, the arrival of a tourism minister there will be a blessing for the people of the Baliem Valley. That is, their festival, their culture is increasingly valued and hopes to be promoted more. "We know Wishnutama is a genius to create an event or festival. His presence there can embrace his community and develop and introduce the potential of Papua's tourism," said Ria. "Even "President Jokowi has often visited Papua. It's time, we pay more attention to tourism in eastern Indonesia that is no less beautiful," he concluded.
